intro: Coelandria obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf coelandria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as forest understories. Coelandria obtusa is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with partial sunlight.
